alert.note: Alert for Berkeley; Charleston; Dorchester (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 30 at 2:49PM EDT until September 30 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR BERKELEY, CHARLESTON AND DORCHESTER COUNTIES... At 245 PM EDT, a social media video showed flood waters entering a garage and doorway to a home near Coosaw Creek in North Charleston. This flood occurred after 4 and 6 inches of rainfall fell across the Interstate 26 corridor from Charleston Airport to Summerville. Flash flooding is already occurring. Periods of moderate rainfall may occur over the area until 4 PM. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... North Charleston, Summerville, Goose Creek, Hanahan, Ladson, I-26/I-526 Interchange, Naval Weapons Station Charleston, West Ashley, Daniel Island, College Park, Crowfield Plantation, Sangaree, Magnolia Gardens, Charleston Airport, Knightsville, Lincolnville, Charleston Southern University, Summerville Medical Center, Otranto and Northwoods Mall. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Report flooding directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 1-888-383-2024 or email your reports to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
